Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.name: Bacterial Spot (Bell Pepper)
Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.description: Small water-soaked spots on leaves that turn brown.
Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.treatment: Remove infected plants immediately. Spray with copper-based fungicides.
Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.prevention: Use disease-free seeds and practice crop rotation.

Pepper__bell___healthy.name: Healthy Bell Pepper
Pepper__bell___healthy.description: The plant looks vigorous and free of disease.
Pepper__bell___healthy.treatment: No treatment needed. Keep up the good work!

Potato___Early_blight.name: Early Blight (Potato)
Potato___Early_blight.description: Dark brown spots with concentric rings on older leaves.
Potato___Early_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb.
Potato___Early_blight.prevention: Mulch soil to prevent spores from splashing onto leaves.

Potato___Late_blight.name: Late Blight (Potato)
Potato___Late_blight.description: Large, dark brown blotches with a green-gray edge.
Potato___Late_blight.treatment: This is serious. Apply specialized fungicides immediately. Remove infected foliage.
Potato___Late_blight.prevention: Plant resistant varieties and avoid overhead watering.

Potato___healthy.name: Healthy Potato Plant
Potato___healthy.description: Foliage is green and free of spots.
Potato___healthy.prevention: Ensure proper hilling and consistent moisture.

Tomato_Bacterial_spot.name: Bacterial Spot (Tomato)
Tomato_Bacterial_spot.description: Small, dark, greasy spots on leaves.
Tomato_Bacterial_spot.treatment: Apply copper bactericides early. Remove infected parts.
Tomato_Bacterial_spot.prevention: Avoid working with wet plants; sanitize tools.

Tomato_Early_blight.name: Early Blight (Tomato)
Tomato_Early_blight.description: Bullseye-patterned brown spots on lower leaves.
Tomato_Early_blight.treatment: Prune lower leaves to improve airflow. Apply fungicide.
Tomato_Early_blight.prevention: Stake plants to keep them off the ground.

Tomato_Late_blight.name: Late Blight (Tomato)
Tomato_Late_blight.description: Greasy, gray spots on leaves that spread rapidly in cool, wet weather.
Tomato_Late_blight.treatment: Remove plant immediately to save neighbors. Fungicides may help if caught very early.
Tomato_Late_blight.prevention: Keep foliage dry and water the base of the plant.

Tomato_Leaf_Mold.name: Leaf Mold
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.description: Yellow spots on upper leaf surface, olive-green fuzz underneath.
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.treatment: Improve air circulation. Apply fungicide if severe.
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.prevention: Space plants properly and avoid wetting leaves.

Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.name: Septoria Leaf Spot
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.description: Circular spots with dark borders and gray centers.
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.treatment: Remove infected leaves. Apply organic fungicides.
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.prevention: Remove crop debris at the end of the season.

Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.name: Two-spotted Spider Mite
Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.description: Tiny yellow speckles on leaves; fine webbing visible.
Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.treatment: Spray with insecticidal soap or neem oil.
Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.prevention: Keep plants well-watered; mites love dust and drought.

Tomato__Target_Spot.name: Target Spot
Tomato__Target_Spot.description: Brown lesions with faint concentric rings.
Tomato__Target_Spot.prevention: Maintain good airflow and reduce humidity.

Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.name: Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus
Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.description: Leaves curl upward and turn yellow; plant is stunted.
Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.treatment: No cure. Remove and destroy infected plants.
Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.prevention: Control whiteflies (the vector) using sticky traps or screens.

Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.name: Tomato Mosaic Virus
Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.description: Mottled light and dark green pattern on leaves.
Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.treatment: No cure. Remove infected plants to prevent spread.
Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.prevention: Wash hands often; smokers should not touch plants (tobacco carries it).

Tomato_healthy.name: Healthy Tomato Plant
Tomato_healthy.description: Leaves are vibrant green and spotless.
Tomato_healthy.treatment: Keep doing what you are doing!
